page.title: 05Weldon Quarry
page.content: On the 13th June a group of us went to the Quarry. 175 m. years ago when this was covered in water it was though that there was a whirlpool in this area which left many fossils. The man who took is round said that someone had found a fossil that weighed 70lbs and was valued at Â£400. Around the quarry were found many caves. Many fascinating things have been found there such as a blacksmiths works shop, horse stables and a cave where some German weapons were found during the 1939-45 war, neatly packed. (The steel works were built from German designs). The limestone in this quarry was not suitable for building, but on the other side of the road the stone from the quarry was and is used to build churches and colleges at Cambridge. In this quarry there was 20' of limestone and 15' of ironstone.
